title: Frédéric Delafond
text:
Frédéric Delafond (2 February 1844 in <a href="Ig%C3%A9%2C%20Sa%C3%B4ne-et-Loire">Igé, Saône-et-Loire</a> – November 1933 in <a href="Paris">Paris</a>) was a French <a href="geologist">geologist</a> and mining engineer.
He received his education at the <a href="%C3%89cole%20Polytechnique">École Polytechnique</a> and at the <a href="%C3%89cole%20des%20Mines%20de%20Paris">École des Mines</a> in Paris. From 1909 to 1914 he was director of the École des Mines.
<a href="Henry%20K%C3%BCss">Henry Küss</a> was named as his successor.
In 1911 he was named president of the Commission du grisou, and in 1913 he became a commander of the <a href="L%C3%A9gion%20d%27honneur">Légion d'honneur</a>. In 1924 he was appointed president of the <a href="Soci%C3%A9t%C3%A9%20g%C3%A9ologique%20de%20France">Société géologique de France</a>.
